projectPurpose: To provide a faster and more efficient way to delete files and directories on Windows, especially large, deeply nested ones with many files, by using parallel processing.
mainFeatures: Faster than standard Windows methods for specific scenarios (large, nested directories)

alternatives.name: Standard Windows Deletion (File Explorer, del, rmdir / rd)
mainFeatures: Basic file and directory deletion via GUI or command line

alternatives.name: PowerShell (Remove-Item)
mainFeatures: Part of the Windows operating system

alternatives.name: Robocopy (/PURGE or /MIR)
mainFeatures: Robust file and directory copying and synchronization
Can delete by mirroring to an empty source or using /PURGE
Designed for handling large file sets and network resilience

alternatives.name: FastCopy
mainFeatures: Optimized file copy, deletion, and synchronization

mostWellKnownAlternative: Standard Windows Deletion (File Explorer, del, rmdir)
marketPositioning: nmuidi is positioned as a highly specialized, performance-focused utility for Windows users who need significantly faster directory deletion, particularly for challenging structures like those found in software build environments (deeply nested, many small files). It differentiates itself from general-purpose built-in tools and other utilities by focusing solely on optimizing deletion speed through parallelization, accepting the trade-off of not including safety features like confirmation prompts.
